channel.title: NO-IP question?
channel.description: When running my server how do I make it so it connects to my NO-IP address instead of 0.0.0.0 on port 5555?

item.title: NO-IP question?
item.dc:creator: @coolkilla coolkilla
item.description:
@coolkilla wrote:

[quote=“jc22493, post:11, topic:264096”][quote author=coolkilla link=topic=348733.msg2682124#msg2682124 date=1235434476]

Change 5555 to 43594. Can you log in?
[/quote] To log in I have to be on port 5555 and Server 0.0.0.0

Idc bout the port lol…I want my NO-IP to work
Server class to change port 5555.[/quote][br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 23, 2009, 06:30:45 pm[/size][hr][quote=“jc22493, post:11, topic:264096”][quote author=coolkilla link=topic=348733.msg2682124#msg2682124 date=1235434476]

Change 5555 to 43594. Can you log in?
[/quote] To log in I have to be on port 5555 and Server 0.0.0.0

Server class to change port 5555.

Can someone try logging on to
staton-pk.no-ip.biz
5555[/quote]

Read full topic
